oai_dc:dc.dc:description: =kagara and !haunu, who fought each other with lightning. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-30 8637-8648). =kagara (a bird who was formerly a man) goes to !haunu (who is a rain's person) to take back his younger sister (!haunu's wife) and return her to her parents. There follows a fight (with lightning and thunder) and blood issuing from the nostrils of !haunu. 1) p.8636v: |han=kass'o heard this story from his maternal grandmother (=kammi) and his mother (|xabbi-an) after his grandmother's death; the =kagara bird; accounting for !haunu's name: he is a rain-sorcerer; 'rain (he) was', 2) p.8637v: names and descriptions of plants and lizards, 3) pp.8641v & 8643v: fighting, 4) p.8642v: see =kagara's fight with !haunu in the east, 5) p.8644v: see Lightning which is black, it is that which kills us, 6) This story is found in Book VIII-30.
